lead_paragraph: Regulators said the latest death, in a Ford pickup, was the first Takata-related fatality in a non-Honda vehicle.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and DANIELLE IVORY

headline.print_headline: 10th Death Is Linked to Airbag by Takata
headline.main: Takata Airbag Flaw Linked to 10th Death; 5 Million More Vehicles Recalled

snippet: Regulators said the latest death, in a Ford pickup, was the first Takata-related fatality in a non-Honda vehicle.
abstract: Federal safety regulators expand recall of cars with Takata airbags from 19 to 24 million and extend it to vehicles made by Volkswagen and Mercedes-Benz after 10th death is linked to them; regulators blame airbags' propellant, ammonium nitrate, which breaks down over time when exposed to moisture, and can cause it to explode.
